open_issues.subject: Project Phoenix - Staging Environment Anomaly
open_issues.title: Profile picture upload fails with spaces in filename
open_issues.description: Profile picture upload fails when image name contains spaces; frontend requests old name, causing API 404. Not a cache issue, but a bug in upload logic.
open_issues.evidence_quote: The profile picture upload is indeed acting up. I figured out that it only happens if the image name contains spaces. The system renames it, but the frontend somehow requests the old, space-containing name from the API, which returns a 404.
participants: Anna Kiss Kiss Anna <Anna Kiss kiss.anna@kisjozsitech.hu>
Gábor Horváth Horvath Gabor <Gábor Horváth horvath.gabor@kisjozsitech.hu>
István Nagy Nagy Istvan <István Nagy nagy.istvan@kisjozsitech.hu>

resolved_issues.subject: Project Phoenix - New Login Page Specification
resolved_issues.title: Google SSO implementation not included in estimate
resolved_issues.description: The specification includes Google SSO, but this feature was not confirmed with the client and is not supported natively by the current system. Implementing it will require extra effort and was not included in the original estimate.
resolved_issues.evidence_quote: Implementing this will require extra effort, as our current user management system doesn't support it natively; we'd need to pull in and configure a separate library. This wasn't included in the estimate.
participants: Gábor Horváth Horvath Gabor <Gábor Horváth horvath.gabor@kisjozsitech.hu>
Péter Kovács Kovacs Peter <Péter Kovács kovacs.peter@kisjozsitech.hu>
Zsuzsa Varga Varga Zsuzsa <Zsuzsa Varga varga.zsuzsa@kisjozsitech.hu>
resolved_issues.resolution_evidence: The SSO was a "nice to have" requirement, but they're not insistent on it if it causes delays. We can remove it from the scope for now.

resolved_issues.subject: User Profile Page - Data Modification Flow
resolved_issues.title: Unanswered question about confirmation email after password change
resolved_issues.description: Eszter Varga asked whether a confirmation email should be sent after a password change, noting the specification does not mention it. This question is currently unanswered and may impact security requirements.
resolved_issues.evidence_quote: should we send a confirmation email to the user after a password change? The specification doesn't mention it, but it would be useful from a security perspective.
resolved_issues.resolution_evidence: we should definitely send an email. It's not a big technical effort to implement.

resolved_issues.subject: Payment gateway API integration - error messages
resolved_issues.title: Unclear error handling for payment gateway failures
resolved_issues.description: Developer is unsure how to handle TIMEOUT or INVALID_CARD errors from the payment gateway due to missing specification details. This is blocking progress on integration.
resolved_issues.evidence_quote: what should I do if the gateway TIMEOUT or INVALID_CARD errors? I couldn't find this in the specification.
resolved_issues.resolution_evidence: For INVALID_CARD: redirect to the payment page with a clear message: "Incorrect card details, please check!". For TIMEOUT: also back to the payment page, but the message should be "Payment failed due to timeout, please try again."

resolved_issues.subject: Payment gateway API integration - error messages
resolved_issues.title: Unaddressed API rate-limiting handling question
resolved_issues.description: Eszter Varga asks if the team has discussed how to handle API rate-limiting and what should happen if too many requests are sent in a short time. No answer is provided in this email.
resolved_issues.evidence_quote: By the way, have we discussed the API rate-limiting issue yet? What happens if we send too many requests in a short time? Do we need to handle this?
resolved_issues.resolution_evidence: Okay, thanks for the quick help! I'll get it done today.

resolved_issues.subject: RE: FW: Question about CI/CD Pipeline
resolved_issues.title: Pre-commit hook error on db:migrate command
resolved_issues.description: Gábor Horváth is encountering an error with the db:migrate command when running the pre-commit hook for automatic test execution. He is requesting clarification or a solution, indicating a blocker in the local CI/CD setup.
resolved_issues.evidence_quote: the pre-commit hook folyton throws an error on the db:migrate command. Is there any trick to this that isn't in the description?
participants: Gábor Horváth Horvath Gabor <Gábor Horváth horvath.gabor@kisjozsitech.hu>
István Nagy Nagy Istvan <István Nagy nagy.istvan@kisjozsitech.hu>
Péter Kovács Kovacs Peter <Péter Kovács kovacs.peter@kisjozsitech.hu>
resolved_issues.resolution_evidence: the test DB needs to be created manually beforehand; the hook itself doesn't do it. The create_test_db.sh script is in the scripts folder.
